00014 #include <vector>

00023 
00024 namespace GeographicLib {
00025 
00026   /**
00027    * \brief Spherical Harmonic sums for a circle.
00028    *
00029    * The class is a companion to SphericalEngine.  If the results of a
00030    * spherical harmonic sum are needed for several points on a circle of
00031    * constant latitude \e lat and height \e h, then SphericalEngine::Circle can
00032    * compute the inner sum, which is independent of longitude \e lon, and
00033    * produce a CircularEngine object.  CircularEngine::operator()() can
00034    * then be used to perform the outer sum for particular vales of \e lon.
00035    * This can lead to substantial improvements in computational speed for high
00036    * degree sum (approximately by a factor of \e N / 2 where \e N is the
00037    * maximum degree).
00038    *
00039    * CircularEngine is tightly linked to the internals of SphericalEngine.  For
00040    * that reason, the constructor for this class is private.  Use
00041    * SphericalHarmonic::Circle, SphericalHarmonic1::Circle, and
00042    * SphericalHarmonic2::Circle to create instances of this class.
00043    *
00044    * CircularEngine stores the coefficients needed to allow the summation over
00045    * order to be performed in 2 or 6 vectors of length \e M + 1 (depending on
00046    * whether gradients are to be calculated).  For this reason the constructor
00047    * may throw a bad_alloc exception.
00048    **********************************************************************/
00049 
00050   class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT CircularEngine {
00051   private:
00052     typedef Math::real real;
00053     enum normalization {
00054       FULL = SphericalEngine::FULL,
00055       SCHMIDT = SphericalEngine::SCHMIDT,
00056     };
00057     int _M;
00058     bool _gradp;
00059     unsigned _norm;
00060     real _a, _r, _u, _t;
00061     std::vector<real> _wc, _ws, _wrc, _wrs, _wtc, _wts;
00062     real _q, _uq, _uq2;
00063 
00064     Math::real Value(bool gradp, real cl, real sl,
00065                      real& gradx, real& grady, real& gradz) const throw();
00066 
00067     static inline void cossin(real x, real& cosx, real& sinx) {
00068       x = x >= 180 ? x - 360 : (x < -180 ? x + 360 : x);
00069       real xi = x * Math::degree<real>();
00070       cosx = std::abs(x) ==   90 ? 0 : cos(xi);
00071       sinx =          x  == -180 ? 0 : sin(xi);
00072     }
00073 
00074     friend class SphericalEngine;
00075     friend class GravityCircle;  // Access to cossin
00076     friend class MagneticCircle; // Access to cossin
00077     CircularEngine(int M, bool gradp, unsigned norm,
00078                    real a, real r, real u, real t)
00079       : _M(M)
00080       , _gradp(gradp)
00081       , _norm(norm)
00082       , _a(a)
00083       , _r(r)
00084       , _u(u)
00085       , _t(t)
00086       , _wc(std::vector<real>(_M + 1, 0))
00087       , _ws(std::vector<real>(_M + 1, 0))
00088       , _wrc(std::vector<real>(_gradp ? _M + 1 : 0, 0))
00089       , _wrs(std::vector<real>(_gradp ? _M + 1 : 0, 0))
00090       , _wtc(std::vector<real>(_gradp ? _M + 1 : 0, 0))
00091       , _wts(std::vector<real>(_gradp ? _M + 1 : 0, 0))
00092       {
00093         _q = _a / _r;
00094         _uq = _u * _q;
00095         _uq2 = Math::sq(_uq);
00096       }
00097 
00098     void SetCoeff(int m, real wc, real ws)
00099     { _wc[m] = wc; _ws[m] = ws; }
00100 
00101     void SetCoeff(int m, real wc, real ws,
00102                   real wrc, real wrs, real wtc, real wts) {
00103       _wc[m] = wc; _ws[m] = ws;
00104       if (_gradp) {
00105         _wrc[m] = wrc; _wrs[m] = wrs;
00106         _wtc[m] = wtc; _wts[m] = wts;
00107       }
00108     }
00109 
00110   public:
00111 
00112     /**
00113      * A default constructor.  CircularEngine::operator()() on the resulting
00114      * object returns zero.  The resulting object can be assigned to the result
00115      * of SphericalHarmonic::Circle.
00116      **********************************************************************/
00117     CircularEngine()
00118       : _M(-1)
00119       , _gradp(true)
00120       , _u(0)
00121       , _t(1)
00122       {}
00123 
00124     /**
00125      * Evaluate the sum for a particular longitude given in terms of its
00126      * cosine and sine.
00127      *
00128      * @param[in] coslon the cosine of the longitude.
00129      * @param[in] sinlon the sine of the longitude.
00130      * @return \e V the value of the sum.
00131      *
00132      * The arguments must satisfy <i>coslon</i><sup>2</sup> +
00133      * <i>sinlon</i><sup>2</sup> = 1.
00134      **********************************************************************/
00135     Math::real operator()(real coslon, real sinlon) const throw() {
00136       real dummy;
00137       return Value(false, coslon, sinlon, dummy, dummy, dummy);
00138     }
00139 
00140     /**
00141      * Evaluate the sum for a particular longitude.
00142      *
00143      * @param[in] lon the longitude (degrees).
00144      * @return \e V the value of the sum.
00145      **********************************************************************/
00146     Math::real operator()(real lon) const throw() {
00147       real coslon, sinlon;
00148       cossin(lon, coslon, sinlon);
00149       return (*this)(coslon, sinlon);
00150     }
00151 
00152     /**
00153      * Evaluate the sum and its gradient for a particular longitude given in
00154      * terms of its cosine and sine.
00155      *
00156      * @param[in] coslon the cosine of the longitude.
00157      * @param[in] sinlon the sine of the longitude.
00158      * @param[out] gradx \e x component of the gradient.
00159      * @param[out] grady \e y component of the gradient.
00160      * @param[out] gradz \e z component of the gradient.
00161      * @return \e V the value of the sum.
00162      *
00163      * The gradients will only be computed if the CircularEngine object was
00164      * created with this capability (e.g., via \e gradp = true in
00165      * SphericalHarmonic::Circle).  If not, \e gradx, etc., will not be
00166      * touched.  The arguments must satisfy <i>coslon</i><sup>2</sup> +
00167      * <i>sinlon</i><sup>2</sup> = 1.
00168      **********************************************************************/
00169     Math::real operator()(real coslon, real sinlon,
00170                           real& gradx, real& grady, real& gradz) const throw() {
00171       return Value(true, coslon, sinlon, gradx, grady, gradz);
00172     }
00173 
00174     /**
00175      * Evaluate the sum and its gradient for a particular longitude.
00176      *
00177      * @param[in] lon the longitude (degrees).
00178      * @param[out] gradx \e x component of the gradient.
00179      * @param[out] grady \e y component of the gradient.
00180      * @param[out] gradz \e z component of the gradient.
00181      * @return \e V the value of the sum.
00182      *
00183      * The gradients will only be computed if the CircularEngine object was
00184      * created with this capability (e.g., via \e gradp = true in
00185      * SphericalHarmonic::Circle).  If not, \e gradx, etc., will not be
00186      * touched.
00187      **********************************************************************/
00188     Math::real operator()(real lon,
00189                           real& gradx, real& grady, real& gradz) const throw() {
00190       real coslon, sinlon;
00191       cossin(lon, coslon, sinlon);
00192       return (*this)(coslon, sinlon, gradx, grady, gradz);
00193     }
00194   };
00195 
00196 } // namespace GeographicLib
